title: Rotting Oranges
description: You are given an m x n grid where each cell can have one of three values: 0 representing an empty cell, 1 representing a fresh orange, or 2 representing a rotten orange. Every minute, any fresh orange that is 4-directionally adjacent to a rotten orange becomes rotten. Return the minimum number of minutes that must elapse until no cell has a fresh orange. If this is impossible, return -1.

brute-force.name: Brute Force
brute-force.description: Multi-source BFS from all rotten oranges.

steps.instruction: Define the function oranges_rotting that takes grid.
Initialize queue with rotten oranges and count fresh ones.
steps.hint: Scan the grid. Add all rotten oranges to the queue and count fresh oranges.

steps.instruction: Run BFS while queue and fresh oranges exist.
steps.placeholderCode:
directions = [[0, 1], [0, -1], [1, 0], [-1, 0]]
    while q and fresh > 0:
        for i in range(len(q)):
            r, c = q.pop(0)
            for dr, dc in directions:
                row, col = r + dr, c + dc
                if (row < 0 or row == rows or col < 0 or
                    col == cols or grid[row][col] != 1):
                    continue
                grid[row][col] = 2
                q.append((row, col))
                fresh -= 1
        time += 1
steps.hint: BFS level by level. For each rotten orange, infect adjacent fresh oranges, add them to queue, and decrement fresh count. Increment time after each level.
steps.solutionCode:
directions = [[0, 1], [0, -1], [1, 0], [-1, 0]]
    while q and fresh > 0:
        for i in range(len(q)):
            r, c = q.pop(0)
            for dr, dc in directions:
                row, col = r + dr, c + dc
                if (row < 0 or row == rows or col < 0 or
                    col == cols or grid[row][col] != 1):
                    continue
                grid[row][col] = 2
                q.append((row, col))
                fresh -= 1
        time += 1

steps.instruction: Return time if no fresh oranges left, else -1.
steps.hint: If fresh oranges remain, return -1. Otherwise return the time elapsed.

steps.instruction: Define the function oranges_rotting that takes grid.
Initialize the queue to store rotten oranges.
steps.hint: Create an empty list (or deque) for BFS.

steps.instruction: Initialize variables for time and fresh orange count.

steps.hint: Store the number of rows and columns.

steps.instruction: Iterate through each row of the grid.
steps.hint: Use a standard for loop for rows.

steps.instruction: Iterate through each column of the grid.
If the orange is fresh, increment the fresh count.
steps.hint: Check if the cell value is 1.

steps.instruction: If the orange is rotten, add its coordinates to the queue.
steps.hint: Check if the cell value is 2 and store it in q.

directions = [[0, 1], [0, -1], [1, 0], [-1, 0]]
    while q and fresh > 0:

            for dr, dc in directions:

                if (row < 0 or row == rows or col < 0 or
                    col == cols or grid[row][col] != 1):
